Hey its my first day writing on this so just some background about me... Jennifer Nicole Lucas is my name :) I am completely in love with my boyfriend of about 1 year, Joey and I go to Huntington High I really only got this thing so I could vent all my stresses and traumas i experience thru-out the summer and stuff like that... I dont really care about spelling or grammatical errors. I dont kno who will read this but i'm sure someone will find it amusing. I dont really have any friends cuz they all seem to stab me in the back. but i refuse to right about stupid shit like the damn war thats 'going on'. although i will talk about the student council elections that are on May 15th...anyone from HHS...vote for me Junior Class Secretary... so anyways, I have this huge MG(multi-genre) shit due in 2 different classes and is totally stressing me out...and a science project that the parents will not leave the freak ALONE! thats it for 2nite, just wanted to test this new stuff out... oh yea, gotta get up at 6 tomorrow for an awesomely fun track meet!

on a whole - today was a WAY better day than yesterday 'cept that I couldn't really highjump cuz my side hurts...hmmm...more injuries i went to the mall with Joey and bought some picture frames to hang some nice pictures in...:) my room is gonna look cool when I finally finish the 3 year process of remodeling my room...lol! i have a track meet tomorrow and i have to get up early again :( pooop! but thats ok... cuz my parents are leaving town tomorrow!!!!! yeeey!!! too bad you can't come over, huh?! lol. i'm bored so i'm gonna post a poem that I wrote and I dont really care what you think about it, unless you like it, then...bring on the compliments!!! lol....its an I am what i am...so if you kno what that is then you have had Mrs. Wacky McY McElroy!! so here goes... I am what I am I am me I am an individual, someone all by herself in the world -- alone solitairy isolated I am original but I am every woman hehe its all in me never a copy or a production of someone else except my parents of course my family - so wonderful small, yet wonderful like me wacky wonderful and wild i sing myself i sing American I sing Nsync insync i am what I am I am perpetually truing to impress always striving to be better, to be the BEST I always want more, the most possible I'm an extrovert but I am what I am with brown hair and brown eyes tall and skinny I know you cannot change me! but i am not a slacker or a quiet one I am loud I like crowds, music, and my boyfriend he is cute I think I love him, wait I know I do Mom says I am too young to know what love and I am what I am but I am not too young I am, though, beautiful others might not think so but I do and thats all that matters I am what I am I am me conceited I am the girl with a spirit like flower petals on a windy day free and always moving never stopping or slowing down.... :) and thats it folks!!! goodnite and thankyou for your time!!! theres more to come (I can tell u are excited)

Life Law #1: You Either Get It, or You Don't... Your strategy: become one of those who get it. Break the code of human nature and find out what makes people tick. Learn why you and other people do what they do and dont do what they dont. Life Law #2: You Creat Your Own Experience... Your strategy: Acknowledge and accept accountability for your life. understand your role in creating the results that are you. Learn how to choose better so you have better. Life Law #3: People Do What Works... Your strategy: Identify the payoffs that drive your behavior and that of others. Control the payoffs to control your life! Another random thought in reference to #1: In almost every situation there are peole who get it and people who dont -- its pretty easy to tell them apart. Those who get it are enjoying the fruits of their knowledge. Those who dont spend a lot of time looking puzzled, frustrated, and doing without. hahaha

Wow, finally! I don't know what's been wrong with this thing the past few days! I haven't been able to log in. Friday I found out that I will be going out of town for 4 more days over spring break which means 4 more days I won't be seeing Joey, unless my parents let him go with us. I'm praying everything works out in my favor, that's so bad. Yesterday I voluntered at the Museum of Art w/ Kat. We saw this new exhibit they have up there from a women who lives in New York. She came to Huntington for a workshop and a bunch of really artistic Huntingtonians(!) helped her build this huge mural(sp?) out of random words, quotes, and stories. Inspired, i decided to write a few of the words down and try it on my own wall. I'll need some stencils, black paint, and a lot of creativity. I think I'm going to write down words that make me smile or give me that happy feeling in my stomach so I can look at this wall whenever I feel sad. Here's what I have so far mixed in with some things the artists had on their canvass: Love, rainbows, spooning, sunny days, hoodies, warm socks, blonde hair, I have drempt of being a mermaid, French Vanilla, colonge, grape jelly, Butterfingers, red roses, virgin daiquiris, money, musicals, you and I will meet again, cute boys, things that glow, sex w/o pain, there are so many things I want to ask him, but now I can't, I must have... Hopefully, that will be enough to cover the small wall behind my door. If it doesn't look to tacky I might extend it to my other walls. After coming home from the museum, of course I was feeling a bit artsy so I finished an art project from last year. It's an outline of Beyonce and I'm filling it in with ripped uo pieces of magazine. I've been looking for just the right color for her hair because I ran out of it last year - hence it being unfinished. I found the PERFECT color on the back of an Nsync picture I had that I needed to take down off the wall that I'm painting on. What luck! I still managed to salvage a few good pictures of the boys and put them on the back of my door. Today feels like a day to watch tv and sleep. It is way too cold to go outside at all. I'm cold right now, sitting in my room. Oh well, pray that it gets warm when Joey comes in town...which is in 5 days!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

So what is this big hysteria about all of West Virginians being related? I think its funny that the Gov'r is making such a massive deal about an Ambecrombie t-shirt. He is starting his own "design a t-shirt" contest to see if he can outsell the company. Maybe he'll find a way to get WV out of major debt!! hah. I'm reading this book by Andy Rooney (the guy from 60 minutes ) and it is really funny. Let me give you an example...his idea to get out of national debt: rent the little circles on dollar bills to advertising companies. Who cares about Lincoln? We wanna see something like the new Adidas shoe! or even a new car? Isn't that great? Its a lot less painful of a way than Mr. Ferguson's idea -- televise a death penalty sentence on pay-per-view. Not only does the person die, but they die by being stretched apart by the ropes tied to their arms and legs. Also - possibly have a lottery to see in which order the person's exteamities come off first! hahah i think thats great but a little extreme. This is a tribute to the nice guys. The nice guys that finish last, that never become more than friends, that endure hours of whining and bitching about what assholes guys are, while disproving the very point. This is dedicated to those guys who always provide a shoulder to lean on but restrain themselves to tentative hugs, those guys who hold open doors and give reassuring pats on the back and sit patiently outside the changing room at department stores. This is in honor of the guys that obligingly reiterate how /smart/funny/sexy their female friends are at the appropriate moment, because they know most girls need that litany of support. In honor of the guys who respect a girl's every facet, from her privacy to her theology to her clothing style. --- Katie....where can I find this guy?! haha I'm going to bed, night everyone

So our journals are due in English class tomorrow and I read a very intriguing article about people who keep diaries. What I learned from this piece: ~~I hate having a public diary because I find myself leaving out, toning down, pepping up, or falsifying many experiences. ~~The prospect of people reading my hand-written diary does not scare me in the least. ~~How many diarists can honestly say they have never once imagined their diaries being "discovered", either before of after their deaths? ~~Once the details of being me are safely stored away every night, I can get on with what isn't me. ~~I find myself editing my former self or jotting notes on the sides of margins so when I re-re-read my journals for the 1,000th time, the sentence once written in the dark at midnight while I was crying, is legible and actually makes sense. ~~I write to entertain, inform, persuade, direct, teach, and warn. "A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush" Shit! I have no bird. I have no bush. God has taken my bird and my bush. I am left with a high mound of unorganized paper that is waiting for me to shuffle through and magically produce an "A" grade AP paper. *sigh* Why does it seem like everything happens at once? While everyone else has cute little quotes or quoted songs on their profiles, I refuse to mask the truth. Relationships are hard! And sometimes they suck, sometimes they are great. But mostly we just spend our time trying to fathom some unreal bonding experience between two people. I don't see any point in trying to hide it. We all know that our significant other isn't perfect, despite the multiple "I love you"s and the random "I was just thinking about you" gifts. We push aside their imperfections, trying, hoping, praying that our relatioship will look better than the other person's. Or maybe we don't think we can do better, bullcrap, there is always someone better out there for you! If you have a feeling, then follow it. But don't try to be someone you aren't or turn someone else into something they aren't. Please, if anything, be true to yourself. I know it sounds cliche but really now, why put so much effort into a relationship that you KNOW is doomed from the start. All I'm saying is to see things for what they really are. Look deeper into someone's heart, look below the skin. I need more caffine or compansion...one of the two...I'll be up all night working on this research paper. Current Mood : I'm lost, I haven't a bird nor a bush Currently Playing : Hopelessly Devoted to You - Olivia Newton John (for old times sake)

The stars have such a beautiful haze of love around them. Nights spent under the stars out in nature are so romantic. These precious moments happen once in a lifetime. It's just you and the sky, well, you can have company consisting of another person, a dog, or even a good book w/ the flashlight to read it. And so in honor of nature, I write the following using colors of paint strips from the hall closet (built up after layers upon layers of paint on this house....... The Cinderella blue of the afternoon sky soon relinquished to a more signature blue. Raspberry sorbet clouds fade into the night sky. The silverscreen stars began to bloom all around me. My mind wanders to those fantasy pink moments in movies. You know the ones...the purple mist outlining the tv, making you want to be the girl whose dream comes true that night. Tranquility blows through the tree branches as I gaze up into the abyss of sparkles. Strawberry cream thoughts swirl in my head. The aqua beads of loneliness stream down my cheeks. Someday I'll have a fantasy pink dress and wild carnation flowers. Someday...but not today. I'm too enveloped in the taos turquoise grass. It is my matteress tonight - also my tissue. The angel food clouds evaporate and I'm left with the night sky, proudly blue and forever vast. The dream is over. I awake in your mocha shake arms.

He thinks I walk on water He thinks I hung the moon He tells me every mornin' They just don't make girls like you He thinks I've got it all together He swears I'm as tough as nails But I don't have the heart to tell him He don't know me that well He don't know how much I need him He don't know I'd fall apart Without his kiss Without his touch Without his faithful lovin' arms He don't know that its all about him He don't know I cant live without him He's my world, he's my everything And he thinks he needs me Sometimes he cries on my shoulder When he's lyin next to me But he don't know that when I hold him That he's really holdin' me And the funny thing is He thinks he's the lucky one God, that song perfectly describes me right now. Joey, just because we aren't dating doesn't mean I don't still love you. I do. Don't worry about that. I always will. And even though we aren't dating, you can still tell me you love me and I can still let you know how much you mean to me. It's not the end of the world. We live separate lives and I can't balance both, I'm sorry. Please give me time to find what I really want. And my answer to your question: I will be here for you to talk to when you decide you can be just my friend. I miss you, dating or not, when you aren't around. We've spent so much time together and no one can take that away - no new boyfriend, no new girl. Our things we have, that mean so much to you, are not shared with anyone else because they belong to us, and us alone. Without you these past two years, I know I'd still be back there listening to my parents fight or you'd still be dwelling on your grandmother's death. I might still be sitting at the top of the steps waiting for Allison to come back. Maybe you'd be back in your old house with the pool, shining your soon-to-be-taken graduation present. I don't want to lose the friendship we had but that's what scares me. When we started dating, we stopped being friends, I never wanted that. I still want to joke and laugh and giggle and wrestle like we did. I want to run to you and cry in your arms and know that everything will be ok and leave at the end of the night feeling better than ever, but maybe not so much. I wouldn't want to put you in any situation that would hurt you. And I'm sorry that the one time I decide to, it's this...but sometimes you gotta let it go.

My English class cannot get along, it just wasn't meant to be. I can't believe such a diverse group of people can even be in the same room with each other without ripping heads off and launching them across the room. Erin, Evan, Katie, Rachel, Nicole, Eric, and Mark all have such different opinions that they clash and cause so many problems. Today in class, we wrote a lot - a marathon writing to be exact. I LOVED IT! I've done it before in Mrs. Macky's class, but this was such a release for everyone. The only rule is you can't talk while we do it. Ms. Ray picks a topic and we write, no questions, no comments. After the allotted time is up, we go around the room and share. I love hearing what people say, what they're actually thinking without hearing someone scream overtop of someone else to argue a dull point. One of the topics was "compassion" and I realized I don't necessarily have any... I wish I was more like Evan Litton, who has such a passion for tennis. *I'll post what I wrote sometime later* So we lost to Spring Valley, which in turn caused us to loose Sectionals. Ok, I promised I'd post what I wrote about Evan and passion so here it is... Compassion - sure I have it - for volleyball, Joey, my dog - but sadly, I have not the compassion that some have. My friend, if I'm still permitted to call him that, once loved tennis so much that his summer days - dawn to dusk - were spent on the court on or in the gym while his 13 friends rode their bikes past as they made their way through the park. Whenever he speaks of tennis now, he enunciates every word - "split step, break point, forehand" - with passion and even gets choked up when he tells me he had that dream again, the one where he's coming back from being down against his life long rival at Kalamazoo(sp?) and its down to the wire - "last serve" he thinks to himself, "don't mess this up, you've come so far." I tell him to keep at it, and I envy him because he listens. there you go - I hope he doesn't mind me writing about him, I doubt he even reads my blog.

I was snooping through Rachel's livejournal comments and noticed that she was having the same "anonymous" posting problem I was confronted with. Someone said to her: "I will never understand why people think that by going onto someone's journal and insulting them ANONYMOUSLY would ever make any difference. Why does it make people feel better to bring others down- but they haven't the courage to admit it?" I really have no clue who said that, but I think it's something we should all live by. Having the courage to say anything about someone, whether it be online posted anonymously or said behind their backs, isn't really having courage at all. What what! I'm back from the cruise with battle scars and a chocolate tan - hah. Everything started out fine, leaving the house and all. Then I realized all the things I had forgotten: my hairdryer, a sweatshirt, my jeans, and a summer reading book. It turns out the sweatshirt and jeans would've come in handy on the ship because it was freezing at night and windy outside. A window fell out of the framing at my grandparents' house and busted my head open - great way to start a vacation. The first day of the cruise was very stressful because Mom and Dad wanted everything to be perfect. Wow, I really don't feel like writing about this anymore. I met awesome people - Alex, Justin, Zach, Bryan, David, Billy, Jessica, and Rissa (I miss you all!). Joey is seriously stressing me out. I haven't talk to him in 2 months and it still gets to me. God help me to keep moving. I'd sure hate to break down here.

The Notebook was the most romantic, smothered-in-love served movie I've seen in a long time. I think that was exactly what I needed to realize what life is really about. I've been so busy worrying about what everyone else wants - who they think I should date, what they want me to do in college, etc. I should worry about what I want. The Notebook reminded me that I have control over my love life and I should follow my heart, because great love can cause miracles. I kept my tears inside until I was outside of the theater because I didn't want to seem like a baby, but once I was in the car, I lost it. Noah and Ali's love comes once in a blue moon and when you think you have that love, never let it go, because chances are that one of you doesn't have the nerve to put pride aside and come "crawling back". My favorite part of the movie most def. was when Noah explained the roles of their relationship. He says to Ali something all these lines: "You're here to tell me when I'm being an arrogant son of a bitch and I'm here to tell you when you're being a pain in the ass, which is 99% of the time, with a two second rebound, then your doing another pain in the ass thing." But the movie wasn't all about sweet love and fights...comedy kept unsmudged mascara from beginning to run. {ali: what if a car comes? noah: we die} It's too perfect. I think I should read the book. Current Mood : I feel like my life is under control now. Currently Playing : Their Song....I'll Be Seeing You - Billy Holiday

For the past 5 days, I have been battered to a black and blue Jennifer. Wednesday, volleyball camp started. Although I was siked to start the season, I was a bit dicey when it came to the new coaching staff. Our head coach, Amber, and her assistant, Jess, are both 24 year old recent graduates of Alderson Broadus. When sports teams have a two week window in June when they can practice, we worked our butts off learning a new defense. Instead of running the defensive rotation that has been pounded into our heads since freshman year, we are now told to do the complete opposite. It might actually work if everyone on the team knew what was going on, but when we get out on the court everything falls apart. It doesn't look good. After camp ended at 4pm everyday, I raced home to quickly take a shower. As fast as I could, I would eat a small dinner and head to work. I seriously almost fell asleep at work one day. Working till 9 each night, then going to bed at 10 is not my idea of a cool summer. I've missed Footloose, my friends, my family, and meals. I've just now started to recover from this volleyball-then-work life. But guess what! I can't write anymore right now because I must be at work in 15 minutes.
